thread.title_full: College football notes: Obama offers condolences to Harbaugh - College Football - NorthJersey.com

author: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS |
title: College football notes: Obama offers condolences to Harbaugh - College Football
text:
President Obama has given his condolences to Michigan coach Jim Harbaugh following the Wolverines’ stunning loss to Michigan State.
Harbaugh told The Detroit News and the Detroit Free Press that he and his wife, Sara, met with the president Monday at the White House following an appearance with first lady Michelle Obama at a higher education awareness event.
He said the president watched Saturday’s 27-23 loss to the Spartans and told the coach it "was a tough way to lose a football game." Leading 23-21, the Wolverines lined up to punt with 10 seconds left, but punter Blake O’Neill fumbled the snap. Michigan State’s Jalen Watts-Jackson ended up with the ball and went 38 yards for a touchdown with no time left on the clock. 
Watts-Jackson was released from the hospital Monday after he had surgery on a hip he injured while scoring the winning touchdown.
The redshirt freshman appeared to land hard on his left hip while being tackled into the end zone by Michigan tight end Jake Butt.
OHIO STATE NOT REVEALING QB: Ohio State coach Urban Meyer isn’t ready to publicly name a starting quarterback for the top-ranked Buckeyes’ game at Rutgers on Saturday.
"I have an idea, but I want to make sure I visit with everybody and make sure we’re doing the right thing," he said.
Meyer must choose between Cardale Jones, who has started all seven games this season, and J.T. Barrett, the starter in 2014 before breaking his ankle in the final regular-season game against Michigan.
Meyer was to meet with the two players Monday afternoon and announce his decision to them.
"If there’s a change, it’s always delicate," said Meyer. "This is not a business here. We’re going to do what’s right for the team first, but does the individual and all that take matter within the confines of this building? More than anybody will ever know. And we’re extremely proud of that."
BRIEFS: UCLA cornerback Ishmael Adams has been charged with misdemeanor battery over a run-in he had with an Uber driver shortly before the start of the season. … Utah starting tight end Siale Fakailoatonga is out for the season after being injured in Saturday’s win. … Florida State defensive back Tre Marshall is expected to miss the rest of the regular season due to a biceps injury.
